page.title: 05RESIDENTIAL HOMES
page.content: Ladygrove is a residential home in Didcot, where elderly people go for a comfortable life. There are two main buildings, the Home and the Day Centre. There are two floors in the Home. In the Home are bedrooms, bathrooms and plenty of lounges. There are many staff to look after you. If something happens, you can use a buzzer to call for help. Mrs Allen is a resident at Ladygrove. She tripped over a tea trolley and the doctor said she couldn't manage on her own anymore. Her son, who lives in nearby Harwell, recommended her to go to Ladygrove. She likes to be independent. The staff bathe her, but the rest she likes to do herself. There are 43 beds in Ladygrove, including one sick bed. 34 staff work there. Downstairs there is a large kitchen and dining room. There is also a small shop.
